3. Hemolytic anemia: This is a broader category of anemia that includes both immune and non-immune causes. It is defined by the presence of hemolysis, or the destruction of red blood cells, which can lead to a decrease in the number of functional red blood cells in the body. In this context, it is mentioned as a type of anemia that can present as an acute hemolytic transfusion reaction.
